original_title: The Paul Good Papers at Notasulga
overview: The Paul Good Papers is an interdisciplinary project based on Bowen’s research into the third wave Ku Klux Klan and its connections to Canada. It also includes a 24-minute looping video projection based on Good’s recording of school integration attempts in Notasulga, AL, in February 1964.  (summary from Flaherty 2021 program notes)
title: The Paul Good Papers at Notasulga
